Dear Ms. Sperling:
Your Child Placing Agency certificate of approval license is renewed. It is valid only at
your present address and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30
days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
James B. Gale, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 296-4814

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit any corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
DCWL Analyst report
The DCWL analyst visited three foster homes and interviewed three foster parent
and one foster child. Two younger foster children were observed.
Safety and concern alert #1
No concerns identified.
Safety and concern alert # 2
It was reported by the foster parents that they were not notified of training
opportunities by the agency.
The agency responded that all foster parents receive mass mailings by the agency of
all training opportunities. In addition, due to the severe needs of the child placed in
the home a referral for wraparound and in-home mental health services was made to
4

provide the family with hands on training specific to the child. This information was
verified by this licensing consultant.
Safety and concern alert #3
No concerns identified.
The interim inspection was completed on 8/9/2018 found the following citation.
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational statewide
automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will be the primary
tracking system and satisfy federal reporting requirements.
The agency for the most part was compliant with this requirement however there
were a few documents that were not uploaded into MiSACWIS. The most common
document not uploaded were quarterly updated medical passports.
This renewal inspection found the agency compliant with this ISEP requirement.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
5/30/19

James B. Gale Date
